job_title: Student Records Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Everyone I've worked with has been great. The work location and hours are flexible. I like the more creative work I do, but the organizing/data entry work is okay as well.
cons: Procedures are out of date often and it is unclear where to get up to date information. Priorities are unclear on one of my teams.

job_title: Financial Services in Denver, CO
pros:
I've had a good experience at Meridian. I left b/c my husband was promoted and we moved so I didn't have any childcare.
I really like workplaces where people are positive about work, personal, just in general. That was the case it Meridian so I really appreciated that. I would say that the Financial Services Team needs more staff. I know that they are working on that so should be fixed soon. 
If you don't have experience in student financial aid then you should let them know that because they might expect you to have experience. I saw that happen twice. 
Be sure to be comfortable with software! Everything is software based!
cons: Lots of cases per staff member. Not enough training time for new team members.

job_title: PhD Student in Portland, OR
pros: I've been working at Meridian for about 6 months remotely doing student records work. Mostly handling files, transcripts, etc. Experience has been positive. Some times the case load is high, but the manager for my domain is aware of it and they are working on it.
cons: Work volume goes up or down. Would be nice for things to be more consistent.

job_title: Digital Marketing Specialist in Los Angeles, CA

review_title: Great faculty and staff, and good learning experience
job_title: Administrative Team in Petaluma, CA
pros:
Staff are friendly and easy to collaborate work. I've honestly never worked somewhere where this many people have positive attitudes and are upbeat.

Good opportunity to learn software and cloud apps.

job_title: Faculty Services Team in Los Angeles, CA
pros: I've had a positive experience at Meridian. Staff I've worked with have been friendly, and the work of supporting faculty is meaningful. I especially like that there is job flexibility as far as work hours and location.
cons: There are students and faculty around the world. Sometimes there are urgent issues and timezones don't match up. Not often, but sometimes things can get chaotic and late if a problem occurs.

job_title: Administrative Team in Petaluma, CA
pros: I've been remote at Meridian for some years now. The workload can be high sometimes, but almost everyone is easy to collaborate with and cares about their work. There is room for advancement over time, which is really important to me.
cons: There are many deadlines and due dates to keep track of. You can't really 'work at your own pace'.

job_title: Marketing Coordinator in San Rafael, CA

job_title: IT Services Team Member in Santa Fe

review_title: Good remote work environment and flexibility
job_title: Student Services Team in Petaluma, CA

review_title: A good fit for the right personality
job_title: Admissions Advisor/Financial Services Coordinator in Petaluma, CA
pros: The small size of the organization can be an advantage - there are many opportunities to take ownership of projects if you show initiative. The staff are thoughtful people who treat their employees with respect. There was a general feeling of intellectual curiosity and a love of reading, which were both nice culture perks. While there, I was able to start helping with some basic payment processing and accounting duties, which I loved. I now have a reasonably well-paid job in financial services, which I never would have had the opportunity to secure if the seeds of my financial services interest hadn't been watered at Meridian :).
cons: I did sometimes feel over-managed -- but I did not get the feeling it was because they didn't trust me to do a good job. It seemed more like the management team just cares deeply about the school, and they wanted concrete evidence that I could excel before encouraging greater independence.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Petaluma, CA
pros: The work can be fun and the staff is great. I learned a lot working there.
cons: The HR policies are terrible --the employee handbook is years old, pay day is only once a month (which isn't even legal in California), hours aren't flexible at all, and they fire people via email to their personal account at night or over the weekend. Who does that? There's absolutely no regard for employee morale. Nights and weekends are required, but that isn't explained in the interview process.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Petaluma, CA
pros:
1. Great office culture. Easy to talk to people with needs or concerns.
2. Very technologically sophisticated. Not a lot of hardcopy of big sit-down meetings.
3. Organized into teams and not "manager-driven" at all.
4. It's awesome to actually be able to meaningly serve students in their graduate education.
5. Petaluma Center is at a great location.
cons:
1. Students take some evening and weekend classes a few days a month, so staff trade off covering those times.
2. There are locations in Petaluma, San Francisco, and Oakland. Some commuting involved -- depends on the position.
3. There are a lot of changes happening inside and out and some growing pains.

job_title: Student Services Team in Petaluma, CA
pros:
Everyone is really into establishing clear procedures and completing things as a team, so if you are into collaboration and building processes, you'll probably enjoy your work. If you'd rather work on your own and in a more "casual" work environment, it may not be a great fit.

+1  faculty really care about the mission.
cons: Everything is very technical and complex - even simple things will require you to use databases and follow specific procedures, at least in student services.

job_title: Associate Director of Academic Services in Petaluma, CA
pros: I really believe in the power of education, specifically higher education, and more specifically TRANSFORMATIVE adult education. Meridian attracts great faculty and the students come from diverse backgrounds  -- many are passionate about their education and inspiring to teach.
cons: Whether you are staff or faculty, a lot of work is done via online applications. So if you aren't comfortable learning and moving between tech platforms, probably look elsewhere.
